clinical_study.brief_title: Microbial Community Transplantation on the Armpit/Foot
clinical_study.official_title: Microbial Community Transplantation on the Armpit/Foot in Order to Reduce the Malodour Generation on Armpit/Foot

brief_summary.textblock: The malodour generation of a person's armpit/foot is caused by the bacteria thriving on that armpit/foot. In order to alter or reduce once bad body odour or foot odour, the living microbial community on the foot/armpit of a non-malodorous person will be transmitted (or up scaled and transmitted) to the foot/armpit of a malodorous person. The odour is evaluated by a trained smelling panel, the bacteria living on the armpit/foot is examined by means of molecular techniques. The microbial transplantation and its follow-up happens under the supervision of a doctor.
